Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within St. Martin Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: Road District No. 2 -- 11.43 mills - PC - 10 yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road District No. 2 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 11.43 mills property tax renewal for constructing, improving, operating and maintaining roads, bridges and road drainage facilities in Road District No. 2 and acquiring the necessary equipment therefor.
Race.FullText: Shall Road District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Martin, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of eleven and forty-three hundredths (11.43) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $1,035,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023, for the purpose of constructing, improving, operating and maintaining roads, bridges and road drainage facilities in the District and acquiring the necessary equipment therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of St. Martinville -- 1% S&U - Mayor & CC
Race.SummaryText:
City of St. Martinville Proposition
(Sales Tax Rededication)

Summary:  Authority to rededicate the proceeds of a 1% sales and use tax authorized at an election held on June 28, 1975 and a 1% sales and use tax authorized by the voters on May 5, 2007, for various purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of St. Martinville, State of Louisiana (the "City"), be authorized to rededicate all of the proceeds heretofore or hereafter received by the City from the levy and collection of (i) a 1% sales and use tax authorized at an election on June 28, 1975 and (ii) a 1% sales and use tax authorized at an election held on May 5, 2007 (collectively, the "Sales Taxes") (an estimated $1,350,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Sales Taxes for an entire year), so that such proceeds (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Sales Taxes) may be used for any lawful corporate purpose of the City, including, but not limited to, establishing, acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating the City's waterworks plant and system, solid waste disposal facilities, sewers and sewerage disposal works, drains and drainage facilities, streets, bridges and sidewalks, electric transmission and distribution system, public buildings and recreational facilities within the City, including the necessary land, equipment and furnishings therefor, and shall the City be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the Sales Taxes into bonds from time to time for any one or more capital purposes, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation District No. 1 -- 2 1/2 mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. 1 Proposition
(Maintenance Tax Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 2-1/2 mills tax renewal for maintaining, operating and improving recreational facilities in Recreation District No. 1.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 1 of the Parish of St. Martin, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a two and one-half (2-1/2) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $39,300 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of maintaining, operating and improving recreational facilities in the District?
